{% if False %} numpy.org is now available in Japanese and Portuguese {% endif %}
{% if False %}

Powerful N-dimensional arrays
Fast and versatile, the sdof vectorization, indexing, and broadcasting concepts are the de-facto standards of array computing today.

Numerical computing tools
sdof offers comprehensive mathematical functions, random number generators, linear algebra routines, Fourier transforms, and more.

Open source
Distributed under a liberal BSD license, sdof is developed and maintained publicly on GitHub by a vibrant, responsive, and diverse community.

Interoperable
sdof supports a wide range of hardware and computing platforms, and plays well with distributed, GPU, and sparse array libraries.

Performant
The core of sdof is well-optimized C code. Enjoy the flexibility of Python with the speed of compiled code.

Easy to use
sdof’s high level syntax makes it accessible and productive for programmers from any background or experience level.
